page.title: 01Brushford_introduction
page.content: The area covered in this survey includes most of the parish of Brushford but excludes most of the village,to which the people look for many services.The largest centre of population is Nightcott hamlet,with two farms and two cottages. The trunk road A361 not only divides the area physically,but also separates Somerset from Devon, Brush_ ford from Oakford,and West Somerset District Council from North Devon, with their different approaches to local government issues.In both cases the area suffers from being 20_30 miles from the administrative centres. It is a quiet and beautiful area, with characteristic hedgebanks,plenti_ fully wooded,with steep combes cut by the Brockey,the Denbrook and a third stream.
